parameters.name: DbName
parameters.description: The number of block index cache hits.

parameters.name: FilterCondition
parameters.description:
The average number of logical reads of the SQL statement during the specified period of time. The value covers the numbers of reads of different caches and the number of disk I/Os. It is an important metric for measuring the SQL filtering performance. >
A higher ratio of the number of logical reads to the number of returned rows indicates poorer filtering performance. General causes include non-standard content written by SQL statements, non-standard table indexes created, and non-standard SQL execution plans.

parameters.name: PageSize
parameters.description: The number of row cache hits.

parameters.name: SQLId
parameters.description: The I/O wait time, in ms.

parameters.name: SearchRule
parameters.description: The IP address of the client.

parameters.name: SearchValue
parameters.description: The number of Bloom filter cache hits.

parameters.name: SortColumn
parameters.description: The number of rows read from the disk.

parameters.name: SortOrder
parameters.description: The list of top SQL statements.

parameters.name: StartTime
parameters.description: The maximum response time, in ms.

parameters.name: TenantId
parameters.description: The average CPU time, in ms.
